Current Students / Undergraduate / Stern Around the World / Short Term Immersions / Stern Around the World: Abu Dhabi                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Stern Around the World: Abu Dhabi  MULT-UB 45 The Middle East: Cultures, Markets, and Strategies        As a student in this Spring 2015 semester course, you will take a trip to Abu Dhabi in January 2015. Here you will examine key cultural, economic, political, and social structures and trends in the Middle East, and assess their implications for business strategies. Dates and an itinerary for January 2015 are now confirmed. Please see below for details.             Program Overview                                              Course Overview                                    MULT-UB 45 THE MIDDLE EAST: CULTURE, MARKETS AND STRATEGIES  3 CREDITS  SPRING 2015  PROFESSOR SUNDER NARAYANAN   snarayan@stern.nyu.edu  OFFICE: 901 Tisch Hall        This course is open to Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors who apply and are accepted into the program.   Additionally, students must meet the following prerequisites:       Minimum 3.0 GPA (study abroad requirement)     Must be enrolled at Stern in New York City for the Spring 2015 semester     Seniors who plan to graduate in January 2015 are not eligible          This course can count as a Global Business elective or a Stern elective.      MULT-UB 45 The Middle East: Culture, Markets and Strategies, is designed as an introduction to the Middle East, with a special focus on the Arabian Gulf (GCC) countries. It will examine key cultural, economic, political, and social structures in the region, and their implication for business strategies. The trip to Abu Dhabi will be used as a context to examine special topics that are relevant to the region. Some examples of topics that would be covered include sovereign wealth funds, the geopolitics of oil and renewable energy, Islam and Islamic finance, cultural issues, demographic and consumption patterns, and entrepreneurship. The topics will be covered through lectures, discussions, guest lectures, company visits, cultural excursions, and projects.                                 Application                                    The application deadline for the January 2015 course and trip has passed.                                 Travel Details                                    Students must check in to the Abu Dhabi residence hall on Sunday, January 4th or Monday, January 5th and stay through the end of the program on the evening of Thursday, January 15th. Students will arrange their own flights to and from Abu Dhabi.                                 Important Dates for 2014-2015                                                      Date                Event                        Friday, October 31, 2014 at noon                Online application deadline for Stern Around the World: Abu Dhabi                        Friday, November 14, 2014                Trip program fee of $1,700 due for accepted students                   Week of November 17      Accepted students will be registered for the course                   December 3, 2014                Mandatory Trip Pre-Departure Session     Time: 5-8:00pm     Room: TBD                        January 4, - January 16, 2015                Trip to Abu Dhabi     These dates include arrival on 1/4, classes and non-academic programming in Abu Dhabi, and return to New York on 1/16.     **Students will arrange their own flights to and from Abu Dhabi. Students must check in with a Stern chaperone at 1 pm on Monday, January 5th and stay through the end of the program the evening of Thursday, January 15th.                   Friday, February 6, 2015           1:00pm-4:00pm- Final exam, class discussion, and debriefing. (Room TBD)                                                    Estimated Expenses                                    Please note: Although you will register for this 3-credit course as part of your Spring 2015 schedule, NYU tuition and registration fees do not cover the additional fee for the trip to Abu Dhabi.    A Trip Program Fee in the amount of $1,700 will be required of all participants. The trip fee will cover:     NYU Student Housing and Meal Plan for 13 days    Group excursions, including transportation      Additional Expenses to be covered by student (not included in Trip Fee):     Airfare (approx. $1,200 - $1,800 - students will make their own flight arrangements.)    Visa fees (if applicable)    Course materials (approx. $30)    Personal expenses & entertainment    **Limited need-based stipends are available for qualified students. Students can apply for the stipend via the online application .                                 Need-based Travel Stipends                                    A limited number of travel stipends will be available for students who qualify. Students can apply via the online application . You must have an updated FAFSA on file with NYU to be considered for this stipend.                                 Passport & Visa Requirements for all Participants                                     Passports : You must have a passport valid for a minimum of six months - through July 2015 - to travel. More information on how to renew or obtain a passport can be found on the U.S. Department of State's website .     Tourist visas : Americans with U.S passports (tourist passports) valid for more than six months beyond the dates of travel do not need a visa to enter Abu Dhabi if the duration of stay is less than one month. This includes U.S. citizens with visas or entry stamps from other countries. If you are not a U.S. citizen, please consult UAE's visa requirements . Students needing visas to travel will work directly with NYU Abu Dhabi staff to obtain the appropriate visa paperwork, rather than going to the UAE Consulate.    Note: It is the student's responsibility to apply and receive the appropriate visas for their passports in a timely manner for the trip. Refunds are not provided for those students who fail to secure their visas.                     Show all | Hide all                                                Learn More!   View this video to see highlights of the trip.                 Questions?   Contact International Exchanges & Special Programs at 212-992-6800. The NYU Stern Student Experience                     The NYU Stern Student Experience                            Home                    This is just a sample of what is to come on the website. Stay tuned for more!            Travel Opportunities :      Elective Courses with Travel Components:             Stern Around the World (SAW):                 Middle East: Cultures, Markets & Strategies (3  Credits)                    This class includes a 2-week  trip during Winter Break to Abu Dhabi where you will stay in NYU Abu  Dhabi's facilities and learn about                 business and  culture in the Middle East                   Social Enterprise and Economic Development: The Indian Context (3 Credits)                A fall  semester course that includes a trip to India for 1  week during Winter Break learning about Social Enterprise &  Economic                 Development in India                Stern Inernational Volunteers  (2-Credit Pass/Fail): A spring semester course that culminates in a 10  day service trip to a foreign country at the        conclusion of the spring semester              NYU Semester Away (with Stern Courses) - Prague, London, Sydney, Shanghai, Madrid, Florence     NYU  Stern IBEX - Singapore, Sydney, Melbourne, Paris, Copenhagen,  Pampalona, Seoul, Milan, Hong Kong, Beijing, Amsterdam, Bangkok     Junior  Spring Break International Studies Program - All Expense Paid 1  Week Trip to One of 3 Major Cities in Europe, South America, or Asia          There are so many opportunities to go abroad - NYU & Stern really believe in the importance of a global educaiton     Best Time to Spend a Semester Abraod: Sophomore Fall, Sophomore Spring, or Junior Fall      67% of Stern Students Spend at least 1 semester abroad          Food Near Stern            Cozy Soup & Burger*, Ben's Pizza, Washington Square Diner, Space  Market*, Pizza Mercato, Campus Eatery*, Halal Carts & Food Trucks  Outside of Stern     * = NYU Discount          Stern Events :    Stern Semiformal, Passport Day,  Spirit Week, Cohort Events, CACE & Explore NYC Events, Gould Plaza  Fair, Waffle Wednesdays, etc.                 Academics:            Concentrations: Finance, Accounting,  Economics, Global Business Marketing, Management, Statistics, Acturial  Science, Information Systems , Operations      You can pick 2 concentration & a minor or 1 concentration & major outside of Stern      Tip: Don't Load Up on All Stern Classes in 1 Semester

All Expense Paid 1  Week Trip to One of 3 Major Cities in Europe, South America, or Asia          There are so many opportunities to go abroad - NYU & Stern really believe in the importance of a global educaiton     Best Time to Spend a Semester Abraod: Sophomore Fall, Sophomore Spring, or Junior Fall      67% of Stern Students Spend at least 1 semester abroad          Food Near Stern            Cozy Soup & Burger*, Ben's Pizza, Washington Square Diner, Space  Market*, Pizza Mercato, Campus Eatery*, Halal Carts & Food Trucks  Outside of Stern     * = NYU Discount          Stern Events :    Stern Semiformal, Passport Day,  Spirit Week, Cohort Events, CACE & Explore NYC Events, Gould Plaza  Fair, Waffle Wednesdays, etc.                 Academics:            Concentrations: Finance, Accounting,  Economics, Global Business Marketing, Management, Statistics, Acturial  Science, Information Systems , Operations      You can pick 2 concentration & a minor or 1 concentration & major outside of Stern      Tip: Don't Load Up on All Stern Classes in 1 Semester
